column2: NM DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: New Mexico

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column4: Speeding is not allowed
column8: You must yield the right-of-way ahead

column2: 2. Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
column4: Cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 3. Before making a left turn from a one-way street, you must:
column4: be in the lane closest to the right curb.
column6: be in the lane closest to the center of the street.
column8: be in the lane closest to the left curb.

column2: 4. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way
column8: the right lane ends.
column10: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 5. Alcohol:
column4: enhances your ability to see clearly.
column6: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column8: makes it easier to make correct decisions.

column2: 6. __________________ is a safe driving technique.
column4: Checking your rearview mirrors frequently
column6: Using your high beam lights in the fog
column8: Starring at the road ahead of your vehicle

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Yield sign ahead
column6: Side road entering from the left
column8: Side road

column2: 8. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column8: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column10: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 9. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Listen to heavy metal music.
column6: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column8: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 10. A school bus ahead of you in your lane is stopped with red lights flashing. You must:
column4: stop until all the children have left the bus.
column6: reduce your speed, change lanes and pass.
column8: stop until the lights stop flashing.

column2: 11. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column8: must always come to a complete stop.
column10: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.

column2: 12. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column4: there’s a narrow bridge ahead.
column8: you must turn right.

column2: 13. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column8: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column10: The driver can legally pass red lights.

column2: 14. To prevent a fatigue-related crash while driving:
column4: continue driving so you will reach your destination sooner.
column6: find a safe parking area to take a 15 to 20 minute nap.
column8: drive at night when there are not as many vehicles on the roadway.

column2: 15. To help relieve fatigue on a trip:
column4: drink coffee frequently.
column8: change feet on the gas pedal.
column10: stop for a rest every two hours.

column2: 16. If you encounter an aggressive driver you should:
column4: show them how to drive defensively.
column8: speed up.

column2: 17. When entering an expressway from the entrance ramp, you should:
column4: go down to the bottom of the ramp and stop until it is safe to enter the expressway.
column6: use the acceleration lane to blend into the traffic.
column8: cross over to the traffic lane as soon as possible.

column2: 18. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column6: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column8: increase your speed immediately.
column10: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.

column2: 19. When approaching an intersection with a traffic control signal that is not working, drivers should:
column4: speed up and proceed through the intersection.
column6: stop as you would if there were stop signs in all directions, yield the right-of-way, then enter the intersection.
column8: try not to stop if the intersection is clear.

column2: 20. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.
column6: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column8: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column10: share the lane with the motorcycle.

column2: 21. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: Never.
column8: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column10: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 22. If the traffic lights are out of service when you approach an intersection, you:
column4: must proceed with caution.
column6: must slow down and yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: must continue according to the rules of right-of-way.
column10: must come to a stop as you would for a stop sign.

column2: 23. When on a short entrance to an interstate where there is no acceleration lane:
column4: use the shoulder of the main road to get up to the speed of the traffic.
column6: enter the far right traffic lane and speed up to the flow of traffic.
column8: speed up on the entrance only after you have found a gap in traffic.

column2: 24. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that are easy to spot.
column8: areas of the road that cannot be seen even when looking into mirrors.

column2: 25. Which of the following is a common cause of a traffic collisions?
column4: Following too closely.
column8: Excessive speed for conditions.
